item.title: EUR/USD's Weekly MACD Seems Set to Cross Into Positive Territory, Charts Show
item.description: EUR/USD’s weekly moving average convergence divergence indicator seemed poised to cross into positive territory, which would augur well for further gains over the next two months, UOB said.

item.title: Breakout Thai Political Star Meets Resistance as He Takes On Military, Monarchy
item.description: Two months after Thailand’s main pro-democracy party won a stunning victory in nationwide elections, its young leader faces mounting challenges.

item.title: Barratt Developments' FY 2023 Update Underlines Sector Pain
item.description: The Barratt Developments update underlines the pain that rising interest rates are causing not just to home buyers, but also to construction companies and any businesses linked to the sector, Begbies Traynor said.

item.title: Metals Rise as Investors Expect Rate Hikes to Stop Near Term
item.description: Base metals and gold were higher, with a less hawkish Fed and a weaker dollar helping to lift commodity prices.

item.title: Brent Holds Above $80 a Barrel as Inflation Eases
item.description: Crude prices rose in Europe, as investors steered towards risk assets after data showed inflation pressures eased in the U.S, with ANZ saying the focus will shift to tightening oil supply, as OPEC+ and Saudi cuts are yet to take full effect.

item.title: UK Economy Contracts Slightly Less than Expected
item.description: U.K. GDP declined 0.1% in May as industrial output slid, a signal that rising interest rates are weighing on economic activity.

item.title: Casino Warns on Earnings, Sales
item.description: Casino said post-lease Ebitda for the year is now expected to be below €300 million on lower sales and that revised offers for its debt restructuring are expected on Friday.

item.title: Google's Bard AI Chatbot Adds More Languages to Take On ChatGPT
item.description: The latest version will also include a privacy hub for all users.

item.title: 7-Eleven Owner's Net Profit Fell on Weak International Business
item.description: Seven & I Holdings said its first-quarter net profit fell 35% due to weakness in its overseas-convenience-store and superstore businesses.

item.title: Aker Solutions Upbeat as Profit Tops Forecasts
item.description: Aker Solutions posted a second-quarter net profit of NOK528 million, raised its revenue guidance said the outlook remained positive with a high order backlog offering good visibility on activity levels for years to come

item.title: Uniqlo Owner Raises Earnings Guidance on Strong Sales
item.description: Fast Retailing raised its revenue and net profit forecasts for the fiscal year ending August, citing strong third-quarter results

item.title: Barratt to Build Fewer Homes But Keeps Profit Outlook
item.description: Barratt Developments said it expects full-year adjusted pretax profit to be in line with the market consensus range despite a lower order book, but sees fewer completions in the current fiscal year.

item.title: Ten-Year US Treasurys Seen Offering Good Risk-Reward
item.description: HSBC is bullish on Treasurys and forecasts the 10-year yield at 3% for end-2023 and 2.5% for the end of 2024.

item.title: Kim Jong Un Oversees ICBM Launch in Show of Force Toward U.S.
item.description: North Korea’s state media describes the Wednesday missile test as a ‘strong practical warning’ to Washington and its allies.

item.title: Swatch Helped by Asia Recovery, Strong Europe
item.description: Swatch reported an increase in first-half sales and net profit, boosted by the lifting of travel restrictions in Asia and a good performance in Europe.

item.title: Court Ruling Upends Guatemalan Election
item.description: The country’s top anticorruption prosecutor said that a court suspended the center-left Seed Movement, whose presidential candidate, Bernardo Arévalo, did surprisingly well in the first round of voting.

item.title: China's June Exports Fell More Than Expected on Weak Global Demand
item.description: China’s exports fell more than the market expected in June, official data showed Thursday, pointing to rapidly weakening global demand.

item.title: The U.K.'s competition regulator said it would need to conduct a fresh investigation into any changes made to Microsoft's $75 billion Activision acquisition aimed at winning approval for the deal.
item.description: The U.K.’s competition regulator said it would need to conduct a fresh investigation into any changes made to Microsoft’s $75 billion Activision acquisition aimed at winning approval for the deal.

item.title: Fueling Jets With Trash? Investment Flows Into Sustainable Aviation Fuel
item.description: Used cooking oils, animal byproducts—and soon your trash—are being used to cut a major source of global emissions: air travel. WSJ explores whether the recent surge in investment in sustainable aviation fuel will help the industry finally take off.

item.title: The Secrets to Snagging Coveted Camping Spots After They've Sold Out
item.description: Campers seeking overnight trips to state and national parks have tools to help find late openings.
